snippet: The Culinary Workers Union said Station Casinos failed to disclosed settlements made by a part owner, Deutsche Bank, this year to settle investigations into its capital market activities.
abstract: Culinary Workers Union sends letter to Securities and Exchange commission saying that Station Casinos, which operates 19 casinos in Nevada, did not disclose in its initial public offering filing that partial owner Deutsche Bank has paid over $2.5 billion to settle investigations into its capital markets activities; letter is part of long-running battle between union and casino owner.
lead_paragraph: The Culinary Workers Union said Station Casinos failed to disclosed settlements made by a part owner, Deutsche Bank, this year to settle investigations into its capital market activities.

headline.main: Scuffle Between Nevada Casino Company and Union Pulls In Deutsche Bank
headline.print_headline: Scuffle Between Nevada Casino Company and Union Pulls In Deutsche Bank
